name: eqtble
headline: Turning HR data into actionable insights
description:
At eqtble, we’re on a mission is to empower companies to make more equitable decisions around their employees. We're building a people analytics platform that enables talent and people leaders to access a rich set of analytics and insights out of their existing data.

Within a short time period, we've vaulted to the top of the HR tech industry with our tech-first people analytics solution. With customers such as Etsy, Chobani, Nuro, Harrys, Checkr - eqtble is on a path to being the leader in the people analytics space.

founders.name: Joseph Ifiegbu, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder and CEO at eqtble
Prior experience
- Led HR Technology at Snap
- Built and Led People Analytics at WeWork
- Lead Data Scientist at Toys R Us
- Data Scientist at Arsenal FC

founders.name: Gabe Horwitz, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder & Chief of Product @ eqtble
-Built HR analytics team at WeWork
-Data scientist at Johnson & Johnson
-Former Israeli Defense Forces Specialist
-Marathon runner (4 marathons)

founders.name: Ethan Veres, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder and CTO at eqtble 
Prior experience
- Software engineer at Butterfly Network
- Software engineer at Jet.com

generated_description:
**Eqtble: Empowering Equitable HR Decisions with People Analytics**

Founded in 2021 and part of Y Combinator's W21 batch, Eqtble has rapidly emerged as a notable player in the HR tech industry. Based in New York and consisting of a compact yet driven team of five, the company's mission is straightforward yet transformative: to turn HR data into actionable insights that help organizations make more equitable decisions about their employees.

At its core, Eqtble develops a sophisticated people analytics platform designed to empower talent and people leaders. By providing a rich set of analytics and insights derived from existing data, it enables companies to navigate the complexities of workforce management with greater awareness and fairness.

In a remarkably short time, Eqtble has garnered attention and trust from reputable clients including Etsy, Chobani, Nuro, Harry's, and Checkr. This speaks volumes about the effectiveness and relevance of its solutions in today’s data-driven business landscape.

Eqtble recently made headlines with its strategic acquisition by Paradox, a leading Conversational AI recruiting platform. This aligns Eqtble's innovative analytics capabilities with advanced AI technologies, promising even more powerful tools for organizations seeking to elevate their HR strategies.

The company is categorized under the tags of SaaS, Human Resources, B2B, and New York, emphasizing its tech-forward, business-oriented approach to solving HR challenges.

For those interested in exploring Eqtble's offerings or scheduling a demo, further details are available on their website: [eqtble.com](https://eqtble.com/). 

With a strong ethos rooted in equity and a proven ability to leverage data for impactful insights, Eqtble is set on a path not just to lead in the analytics space but to redefine how businesses engage with their most valuable asset—their people.
